title: International
content:
During a Gaza peace summit in Egypt, Turkish President Erdogan playfully urged Italian PM Meloni to quit smoking, a habit she admits helps her connect with leaders.  Erdogan, championing a smoke-free Turkey, received a humorous dismissal from French President Macron and a witty retort from Meloni about her social life. The summit itself focused on ceasefire efforts and reconstruction.

The US passport has dropped to 12th place globally, its lowest ever, losing visa-free access to key destinations like Brazil and China. This decline, attributed to inward-looking policies, contrasts with China's expanding global reach and openness. Consequently, more Americans are now seeking second passports and alternative citizenships.

You look great, but stop smoking, says Erdogan to Meloni; Macron laughs, It’s impossible
